trans-unit.source: Provides the core implementation for all validation controls derived from this class.
As an abstract class, it cannot be instantiated.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The BaseValidator class inherits from the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextControl> base class, and thus has a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextControl.Text%2A> property.
In the event of an invalid entry, the validator displays the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextControl.Text%2A> property.

If the property is not set, the validator displays the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.BaseValidator.ErrorMessage%2A> property instead; this is the text that is shown in the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ValidationSummary> control.
This behavior is consistent with Web Forms validators.

Of the ASP.NET mobile controls, those that support validation are the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextBox> control (its <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextControl.Text%2A> property) and the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList> control (its <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList.SelectedIndex%2A> property).
Other controls can participate in validation by including a <xref:System.Web.UI.ValidationPropertyAttribute> attribute.
For more information, see the [How to: Validate Against a Specific Value for ASP.NET Server Controls](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) documentation.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.BaseValidator"></xref> class.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Although you cannot directly construct a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.BaseValidator> class, you can call this constructor from the constructor of an inheriting class.
Determines whether the specified control to be validated has a property that can be validated.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The name of the control that has a property to be validated.
The name of the property that is to be validated.
either the name or propertyName parameters is .
Determines whether the properties to be validated are valid.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if control properties to be validated are valid; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.BaseValidator.ControlToValidate*> property is empty or the control does not exist.
Gets or sets the ID of the control to validate.
The default value is <xref:System.String.Empty>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Throws an exception during pre-rendering if the ID is empty or not valid.
The ID of the control to validate.
Constructs and returns the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style"></xref> object to be associated with the control.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
A new <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style"></xref> object.
Virtual method for derived class to create its own aggregated Web validator.
The Web validator is for getting and setting of the common properties of Web base validator.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Creates and returns the corresponding Web Controls validator object.
The default implementation of this method in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseValidator> object returns null.
An aggregated Web validator.
Gets or sets the display behavior of the error message of the validation control.
The default value is <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ValidatorDisplay"></xref>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The Display property supports only the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ValidatorDisplay> value.
The .NET Framework Web Forms <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ValidatorDisplay> enumeration represents the different display behaviors of the error messages in validation controls.
The display behavior of the error message of the validation control.
Gets or sets the text that will be used for the error message.
The default value is <xref:System.String.Empty>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This property is used in two ways.
First, if there is no value for the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.BaseValidator.Display%2A> property, the value of the ErrorMessage property is used in its place.
Second, when the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ValidationSummary> control is used, the summary uses the value of the ErrorMessage property for each validator that represents an invalid control.
The text that will be used for the error message.
Called during the validation stage when ASP.NET processes a Web Form.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
You can override this method with a derived method to provide your own validation logic when implementing your own validator controls.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the validator is valid, otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the data validated by the control is valid.
The default value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the data validated by the control is valid; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Raises the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control.Init"></xref> event.
None
Raises the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control.PreRender"></xref> event.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
None
Gets or sets a reference to the style properties for a control.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
None.
Performs control validation, and then sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.BaseValidator.IsValid*> property based on the results of the validation.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The Validate method causes the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.BaseValidator.IsValid%2A> property of the control to be set to `true` or `false`, depending on the outcome of the validation test.
Returns the approximate weight of the control, in characters.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
None.
